articles.title: Oregon reports new single-day record 24 COVID-19 deaths - KGW.com
articles.description: The previous single-day high for deaths in Oregon was 21 on Nov. 24. Tuesday marks the fourth time Oregon has reported at least 20 deaths in one day.
articles.content:
PORTLAND, Ore Oregon has set a new single-day record for reported COVID-19 deaths.

articles.title: COVID-19 can damage lungs so badly that 'only hope' is transplant - Medical Xpress
articles.description: Case studies and autopsy results are confirming that, in some cases, COVID-19 can cause such severe lung damage that patients require a lung transplant to survive.
articles.content:

articles.title: First Alzheimer's blood test now on the market, without FDA approval - CBS News
articles.description: More than 5 million people in the United States and millions more around the world have Alzheimer's, the most common form of dementia.

articles.title: Asthma sufferers 30% less likely to contract Covid-19, study claims - Daily Mail
articles.description: Israeli experts found a higher proportion of asthma sufferers in the group who tested negative for coronavirus than those who tested positive in a 37,000-strong cohort.

People who experience asthma are 30 per cent less likely to contract Covid-19, according to a new research paper.
